==Test Applications==

The following applications are included to test different components and to serve as examples.

  * Box - The simplest example of a JGF application ([http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/box/box.xml config] - ).

  * Console - How to use JGF console ([http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/console/console.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/box code]).
  * Display - Example of the DisplaySystem, which allows to easily define simple HUDs and text ([http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/display/display.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/display code]).
  * Fader - How to use the !FaderView node to apply a fade-in and fade-out effect ([http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/fader/fader.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/fader code]).
  * GameStateWrapper - Wraps JME !GameStates into JGF !ViewStates ([http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/gamestatewrapper/gamestatewrapper.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/gamestatewrapper code]).
  * Menu - Tests the (simple) default menu system ([http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/menu/menu.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/menu code]).

Remember that components can always be extended or replaced if the default ones don't fit your needs.

==JGF Base Project Skeleton==

A base JGF project with a basic structure is provided to make starting a new project a cut-and-paste matter. Including Ant build script and libraries.

==Tanks Game==

A complete game is provided with with JGF: [Tanks Taunklet]. Follow the link to learn more about it.
